column3:
Tested on OSX with boost 1.56.0 & ./configure CXXFLAGS="-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER -g -std=c++11" compiling now works fine.

Verified that 9fbeea7d5b0a3505f173f690d1b0f677113ffeed & 6362b7799628a2bfcfbf99ecdfcf8289fe488e53 are indeed MOVEONLY.
@laanwj Ok to rebase here after #5513 is pulled in, since that will conflict here? That'd spare a move-only verification.\n
Thanks! Rebased after #5513. Confirmed still working on osx 10.9 with libc++.\n

I'm terrified. This makes me yearn for the old days:

```
static const uint8_t ext_public_key[] = {0x04, 0x88, 0xB2, 0x1E};
base58Prefixes[EXT_PUBLIC_KEY] = std::vector<uint8_t>(ext_public_key, ext_public_key+sizeof(ext_public_key));
```

Boost doesn't add anything of value here.
(edit: heck, or even just four push_backs, it's four bytes we're talking about...)
Yes, thanks for moving this to the .cpp file, all that code doesn't belong in the header in the first place.\n

@laanwj I was trying to keep the changes to a minimum here for the sake of review, but I very much agree that this is ugly as hell and completely unnecessary. I have changes in a refactor branch that remove boost here altogether and make this much more straightforward. Would you like me to go ahead and pull those out and PR them?\n
